qas.question: When was the bipolar transistor created?
When did transistors start replacing vacuum tubes in computers?

context: The bipolar transistor was invented in <a0_0>1947.<a0_0/> From <a1_0>1955<a1_0/> onwards transistors replaced vacuum tubes in computer designs, giving rise to the "second generation" of computers. Compared to vacuum tubes, transistors have many advantages: they are smaller, and require less power than vacuum tubes, so give off less heat. Silicon junction transistors were much more reliable than vacuum tubes and had longer, indefinite, service life. Transistorized computers could contain tens of thousands of binary logic circuits in a relatively compact space.
